posts.com:
Not sure this is the right thread, but I wanted to point something out.

Everyone is focused on the differences between men and women. Vitriol and criticisms get thrown around, but both sides ultimately want the same thing. The question is, what makes the modern dating scene so different than it was in the past? Why are the statistics changing so drastically in such a short amount of time?

"Men aren't having as much sex as they used to." I would say that men feel that the majority of women aren't worth the effort.

"Women are having about as much sex as they ever did, but they gravitate toward the same men." I would say that women feel that the majority of men aren't worth the effort.

Again, both sexes want the same thing and have the same issue. However, this has been the case for a long time, so why are things different today? I think something no one talks about is the fact that we are so much more aware of the dangers of the world and consequences of one's actions than previous generations. Crime rates are down as well, meaning people are choosing to live safe and easy lives in general.

My conclusion is that less sex is happening today simply because people are choosing to be more careful given their greater awareness of the way things are. Men don't want to end up giving up their money and kids in divorce, women don't want to get raped or drugged or beat up. And both sides definitely don't want to marry the wrong person and set a terrible example for their children. To avoid all this trouble, it is smarter to keep to oneself until someone truly outstanding comes around.

This observation isn't necessarily meant as advice, just a reminder that the news media paints a blurry picture. Trying to give you folks some faith here; it's not as bad as people would tell you. People are just more mindful today. The best way to proceed is to have fun and enjoy life while staying true to yourself and your values. You will attract the right person in time.

>>28142011
>how risky is the pull out method if the girl tracks her fertility cycle?
Not particularly risky. I wouldn't advise you to use it unless you're okay with a pregnancy happening with your partner even if not specifically looking, but it's a good enough way to prevent pregnancy if you're not looking.
Obviously it's not advisable to use this with a hook up, both due to the risk of pregnancy and STDs.

If you want some numbers, the efficacy of pull out method is about 80% (which means that 80% of the couples that use this method don't become pregnant in a year), while for calendar method (so just tracking your cycle with the app) it's around 80%. Combined they're good enough protection in my book.
I'd advise to use a more reliable method for tracking your period like basal temperature, if you are not extremely regular (which can be the case for a lot of young women).

Hope this helps :)

The threshold to cold approaching is high for most guys, especially these days with how women are etc. You can also try going to a bar or club, either with friends, or alone and if alone you might want to chat up some guys to have as wingmen. The wingmen can help get you over the threshold, pump you up, push you to do it. Also put on your nicest clothes. There might be girls approaching you at bars and clubs. Another thing is talk to only guys at bars and clubs for some time, then after some time you start talking to girls but you don't view them as girls, don't think of them as sexual objects, think of them as guys, talk to some girls but try to have the exact same mindset as when you talked to the guys, them just being people you want to chat to with no attachment to outcome, it might help to only talk to ugly girls at first to get that mindset. I think a big problem for a lot of guys when they approach girls at bars and clubs is that they only have sex as their goal, that makes you look needy. I see these guys the last hour at clubs, they have the wrong mindset, you have to go there and have fun and talk to all kinds of people with no outcome dependence. If you've never done that before it might feel strange but when you talk to guys at bars/clubs for a while it can be fun. Try the smoking room if there is one.

posts.sub: My advice for single men struggling to find a romantic partner.
posts.com:
I am writing all this mainly from personal experience, I would send this back in time to my younger self if I could, but I can’t so I’m writing this here hoping I can help someone that’s in a situation similar to that I was in.

Deep inside, you probably already know a few things you should do to improve your life but there are lots of habits and beliefs that prevent you from actually acting. I could sum up this post by making a short bullet point list of things you should do to turn your life around, but I know I wouldn’t have done them if I sent them to my past self, instead I want you to be truly convinced that doing them will actually improve your life and any apparent sacrifice you might initially make will actually pay off much more than what you expected.
Since it’s a long text I’m dividing it into paragraphs to make it more readable.


——— The first thing you should do to improve your life ———
If I could pinpoint a single thing you can do *right now* to change for the better that isn’t that hard to do, carries the most benefits in all areas of life, and which most people would benefit from, it would be to stop watching porn. [1/9]

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141510

A lot of people (myself included in the past) have a big disconnect and don’t even realise how far they’ve gone with their porn addiction, most don’t even treat it as such and don’t see it as a problem (ignoring the fact that they get withdrawal symptoms the moment they try stopping).
I challenge you to make this thought experiment: how would you feel if your mother, or sister, or a daughter you might have in the future started doing porn and you had to watch it? Just the thought of it feels disturbing to say the least, it’s something that could probably drive someone insane like some form of torture… and yet when you watch porn you are in fact watching someone’s daughter or sister or mother, totally disconnected from the disturbing reality of what’s behind the video4chan. You are mentally blocking out that fact, the same way you do when you see an actor as the character he is impersonating in a movie… but if you ignore the facade what you are doing is actually watching strangers who probably never met each other before, having sex on camera in the most humiliating ways possible, over and over, with always different people, in different scenarios, portraying different fantasies and fetishes, almost (if not) every day, non stop.
This kind of constant exposure inevitably trickles down into everyday life, making it miserable and perverted. A lot of people don’t even develop socially and use porn as a substitute for interaction with the opposite sex. Some struggle to say “hi” to a woman on the street, but in private have no problem watching someone’s daughter getting violently gangbanged by a group of strangers on camera.

When you do stop watching porn you realise just how much it changed the way you looked at the world. [2/9]

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141511
Relationships while “on porn” become a way to recreate your porn fantasies, you stop seeking for a partner that could become a wife and maybe a future mother who could one day raise your children, but instead you look for someone willing to fuck you as soon as possible in the most humiliating ways. Relationships become disposable, you skip to the next partner the way you do with videos, never satisfied. Or maybe porn has damaged you so much that you can’t even manage to have a relationship, and so the negative feedback loop begins where you watch more porn to cope with the solitude and further alienate yourself from interacting with the opposite sex.

It’s simple to stop watching porn, it’s hard to do it for a long time if you’re addicted. But little by little you will recover, believe me. It took me a year of effort and relapsing to stop porn for good, but I did it and I’m not special, you can do it too if you really want. There are hundreds of guides online to help you with it, you just need some willpower and determination, if you do relapse you must have the strength to stop again and not give up. Also, like most addictions, the symptoms will gradually improve as you lower you porn consumption. So even if you don’t manage to stop right away you start seeing benefits the moment you reduce porn consumption. [3/9]

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141514

——— How to find a fulfilling relationship ———
Probably a lot of you who struggle with finding a partner at some point will install some dating app to meet people of the opposite sex, this is a terrible idea if you want to have anything more than a friend with benefits, and even if you just want a fuck buddy because you still have a “porn mentality” you aren’t doing yourself any good.
There are millions of reasons why dating apps are a bad idea, I really shouldn’t be the one telling you this. One of the many reasons simply from a business standpoint a dating app makes money on regular users, so it’s in their best interest to deter people who want a long lasting relationship (who would use the app only once and never again), and incentivise sex addicts that come back on the regular to find new one night stands.

What you want to do instead is to find social groups or activities that allow you to meet and interact in real life and organically with women and other people. Possibly something that you genuinely enjoy. Keep in mind that certain people gravitate towards certain activites, so the same way you don’t look for a future life partner on dating apps you shouldn’t expect to find one in clubs, at a random bar or in a rave party. More on that later.

Before you start looking for a partner you should know what you’re looking for. If you have been a long time porn user you probably have a lot of physical requirements for your partner, because that’s what you get through video, mainly physical appearance… and that’s reinforced even by dating apps and social media (and western society as a whole really), where the discriminating factor to know if someone is likeable or not is physical appearance. [4/9]

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141518
My advice is to substantially drop your physical beauty standards for three reasons:
1) If you’re struggling to find a relationship you probably aren’t Brad Pitt in looks, be realistic in what you have to offer.
2) A good long lasting relationship is built on trust, shared values, and commitment. Looks fade away pretty quickly and contribute very little past the “honeymoon phase” of a relationship.
3) Beauty is actually deceptive: a very good looking women gets approached very often every day, in a society that puts sex on a pedistal, you can be pretty certain that any good looking woman that doesn’t have very strong traditional values will have slept with dozens of men. This isn’t some incel rethoric, it’s reality, and eventually when you have fucked so many people you inevitably become desensitised to regular affection.

If you exclude physical appearance from the criteria for selecting a partner most people have no clue what they want from the opposite sex.
I think the most important thing in a relationship is trust and having shared values, you want to be with someone that will be on your side, for everything in life, not there just to fuck. My advice is to first look for someone with compatible values, but keep in mind that no one will be a perfect match. Realise that people lived most of their life without you and when you first meet them inevitably there will be friction, but once a relationship matures your lives will align more and more with time so what at first doesn’t seem a perfect match becomes so with time and effort. [5/9]

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141521
There is this idea that is perpetrated by Hollywood and the media that finding your “soulmate” is like finding the unique missing piece of a puzzle, where once you find it and snap it on everything is perfect and you finally can see the whole picture… but in reality the perfect relationship is more like a painting with two artists, you both have practiced all your life living, and experienced different things, before you met each other, and once you meet the art styles will be inevitably different. What makes the painting a masterpiece is the time and effort and the collaboration that you put into it. Of course there are some people that will be more compatible than others and some outright incompatible, but I want you to discard the “unique piece” mentality because a great relationship is built together it’s not found. [6/9]

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141524

——— Values that make life meaningful ———
People rarely talk about values anymore, most never ask themselves what they believe in… who cares about values when you can be filthy rich or famous or powerful and influential? That’s what society teaches us: from cradle to grave we are taught to look up to the rich and famous, because if we work hard enough one day we will be able to buy the same stuff they own, fuck as many people as we want, drive the same car, live in the same expensive city, in our own mansion as big as theirs; and we are taught that we are truly liberated when that’s our aspiration… maybe 99% won’t get there but that 1% that does will finally be “happy”. But it doesn’t have to be like that.
I’ve learned that you can be happy in poverty and content even when you are “unremarkable” by societal standards, since the most precious things can’t be bought with money or power. All my advice up to this point has been secular, but it is in fact what what religion has taught for thousands of years, you don’t need to re-invent the wheel to be happy and find like minded people with a good morality. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141046
If you do not have an in-depth education regarding financial strategy, how markets work, or have any specific knowledge about a particular industry that would help you strategize, then the stupid-simple option that practically guarantees returns, and often beats out more involved approaches or even mutual funds, is investing in Market-index funds. Market funds track the market based upon the top companies along a diversified set of industries so that you're not only investing in high-performers, but also spreading your risk out to avoid a single company or a single industry having a bad year causing you losses. It guarantees good gains, and saves you from hard losses; what it is unlikely to be is a "get rich quick" method, which people are addicted to nowadays, but it is safe, reliable, and keeps you from having to put a lot of strategy or thought-work into investing, you just pop your money in and let the market do the work for you. Warren Buffet likes this strategy, for what that's worth (a hundred billion, apparently).

https://www.cnbc.com/2022/10/03/billionaire-warren-buffett-swears-by-this-inexpensive-investing-strategy-that-anyone-can-try.html

Good savings is 6 month's take home pay, that's the rainy day fund. Put it in a high-yeald money market account and leave it alone unless you have a true emergency or are adding in because your pay has increased.
Make sure to have about a month's pay in checking for quick access too.
Investments are highly subjective. Like other anons said, it depends a lot on your situation (wants/needs/goals/level of time/level of risk aversion).
Precious metals are stupid easy. Buy 10oz gold/silver. Put it in a safe. Repeat. Shit never goes down in any meaningful way. Decent returns, very safe.
I've never had an issue with realistate myself. I have a property manager that handles my portfolio and each unit has a home warranty/solid insurance policy incase a renter rips the copper pipes from my walls. All I do is file taxes once a year, sign leases as they renew, and let the money come in. Simple as. That said, no clue what EU laws are like. Get educated on them and on any areas you plan to invest in.
Honestly, if you're busy and dont want to learn just have a brokerage firm manage your shit. Make sure they get paied based on what they make for you and you'll be fine.
It's all about balancing what you want to make with how much time/effort you want to directly contribute.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141046
Real estate in tourist-trap areas, or even other EU countries that are still cheap. Famous landmarks, city centers and islands are safe bets for airbnb properties.
Smaller appartments that attract couples on a budget will almost never remain unbooked in cities like Rome, Athens, etc
Larger appartments are only worth it if the location is really good. Mine near the Acropolis made 102k euros before taxes and company fees in 2022. Still had a few days unbooked over the year, meanwhile my buddy's small appartment in the city center made much less than that but didn't have a single day unbooked. I could have 5 of those if I sold mine, but then you're going all-in on airbnb and that's risky.
Another safe bet are vacation homes/villas that you pretty much only run during summer.

>I don't feel I have anything left to find meaning in.
I've found finding meaning to be completely meaningless. In my case, I became completely obsessed with raw pragmatism. I could sit around navel gazing about "What's my meaning here on this Earth?" or think about stuff like, "It's too fucking cold in this house, what can I do about that?" The latter is more urgent and important, so it wins out. The problem with "finding meaning" is that although it'simportant, it's also really, really not-urgent--it's also not _that_ important because you can live your life without it. There's a weird philosophical asymmetry in it.
>morbidly depressed
What's your cope? Loads of dark humor? I kind of like depressed people, they're always really honest and are pretty funny.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28141643
>even the post office
That's on its way out too. The Federal Employee's Union have been the main lobbing effort to keep it, but USPS as a whole is such a money suck that it's days are numbered. It gets harder and harder to justify each year. Across the board, pensions, in any field, are pretty much gone.

Biggest "out of the gate" draws for military specifically are:

College. The GI bill will cover 2-4 years depending on the uni, plus you get a $3k (adjusted for region/inflation) a month stipend so long as you're above a D average. Stipend is tax free. Also there is a world of vet only scholarships/grants.

Trades. Certs and licenses for little to no cost. Everything from coding, to flying, to forklift operation, to Lean 6 Sigma. All at industry standard and Dep of Labor backed.

Realistate. VA loan basically inflates your credit score by 15pts, and allows for zero down on property with favorable tax rates. Plus it can be endless re-used so long as the borrower doesn't exceed a regional loan cap in any one zip code.

Healthcare. It sucks but it's free. Full medical, dental, and vision. Plus you can sue for malpractice now so things have gotten a lot better since I came in in 05.

There's more, but those are the angles my friends currently recruiting say work best.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>28137212
You can change habits anon but the older you get the more a major life event is needed to make those changes. I personally got diagnosed with cancer back in June and my doctor told me before I started immunotherapy to stop eating beef, fried food, drinking alcohol, and to start eating more veggies/fruit, white meat (chicken, pork), seafood, etc. I stopped all the stuff I was told, and it was tough at first cause I had routines like getting fast food on weekends, and drinking with my friend (I really like making cocktails, and have a whole cabinet full of expensive booze). I just slowly started changing things up and after 30 days of the routine I've now not had any of those thing I'm not supposed to have for over 6 months I've also lost over 30lbs which is partially because the immunotherapy drugs fucked with my thyroid, but hey weight loss is weight loss I also don't have a lil beer pooch over my tummy anymore and my Chad Chin™ has reappeared.

I also wasn't the best at dental hygine until back in November I broke a tooth, found a new dentist (hadn't seen one in a decade) and that (and getting a new crown) spurned me to start brushing more and taking better care of my teeth.

I'm in my 40s so if I can make these changes I'm sure you can as well it just takes a will to do it. If it seems like too much remember you can make little changes that build towards greater change like maybe stop drinking soda for a month, then after you get that down pat you can add no more fried food, etc until you build your new habit up.

Good luck anon, you might not think you can do it but I'm sure that you can.

You have to look at any job application from the employers perspective. What is it that YOU can bring to THEM? How does hiring YOU benefit THEM? And here's the clincher, how does the benefits YOU bring stack up against or compete with ALL THE OTHER CANDIDATES?

Btw, "they get an employee" is not an answer to that question. So you need to start at the absolute bottom in a shithole dead end job where they need employee scale but face high turnover so basically everyone who applies gets hired. That's where you need to focus your applications. Build up some work experience over 18 months and you'll be in a much better position to get employed somewhere else.

Remember, a paper qualification is meaningless in 2023 without experience.

I felt the same way at 18 op and that was in 1997, I didn't have the internet until like a year later though and it really wasn't more than just a novelty until about 2010 for me outside of illegal downloads and porn but I grew up in a small town. Thought I'd never get anywhere or do anything.
Things are definitely fucky now and it was all definitely easier back then.
Get out of your comfort zone, you're going to fuck up and make mistakes but you'll also start to actually figure yourself out. Everything seemed so drastically important at that age and none of it was.
I'm by no means successful but I'm comfortable and content with my life lived now. Mix shit up, if you're not in school maybe look into a tech school or a trade school. I went to college and still ended up homeless for a while and ended up in a trade in the end because it pays way better than the shit I went to college for.
Think of your early 20s and late teens as immersion therapy for the person you'll become. Do stupid shit, take some risks, you have decades left and very few things you do now will impact you for the rest of your life.
Fuck man, go hit the road with your buddy and take a road trip. When I was 18 I would have never thought I'd sleep on a hotel room floor with 20 other people in new Orleans at Mardi gras just a few years later. I wouldn't do it today but it doesn't mean it isn't a fond memories.
It's fucking hard getting out of your comfort zone but if you don't you're gonna blink and 20 years will be gone and you'll wonder what the hell happened.
What are you interested in? What do you wish you could do?

>>28133799

You are 18. I want you to realize that i am 31. I have twice as much life experience when I post this advice to you.

>Spent most of my life in my room because...grew up with slightly neglectful parents.

This is something that isn't 100% your fault, nor is it exactly unique. I knew a lot of neglected schoolmates growing up who ended up like this, introverted and kind of out of sorts with the world. Don't use it as an excuse.

>I was always a lil weird, didn't fit in,

Most people who are weird just need to practice social skills. You can start by reading books. I recommend the 48 Laws of Power to get a grasp on human nature at a higher level (how to interact with people in business settings, formal settings, family settings, anything where something is at stake, which is ALWAYS). I also recommend The Definitive Book of Body Language for learning how to read people, and other body language books. People Can't Drive You Crazy If You Don't Give Them the Keys is another one, especially if you deal with shitty people on a regular basis.

> I'm seriously empty and avoidant, and my life experience is completely alien, far removed from that of any normal person.

You are missing a third space. You have home and work, but not a social space. You have one friend, and you admit he is lame. I would not abandon him per se, but if you regard him as a loser, you must follow one of the laws of power and avoid him, as he will drag you down. Find social events near you. Do you have interests besides video games? Perhaps you could join a writing club? Do you have strong political opinions? Join a political organization. I'm doing that to get my city to rid us of the homeless since the city I live in seems to be influcend/staffed by bleeding hearts who give those vagrants things which makes them stay. Hell, join a sewing circle (lots of milfs and cute girls) or a pottery class (make cool shit and meet art girls), or go to auto shows and ask about meetings and clubs.

Definitely hit Osaka, Kyoto and Toyko if you can. I'll list some of the attractions but honestly there is heaps to do.

In Osaka see the Osaka Castle, Nara deer park and Shinsekai district.

In Kyoto see Nijo Castle, Thousands Torii Gate and Kiyomizu-dera with the surrounding old shopping streets.

In Tokyo, go up the Skytree and Tokyo Tower, and visit akihabara and shinbyua.

In terms of accommodation you can honestly just wing it at grab a cheap place from Expedia or whatever, they tend to be good. Tokyo was harder to find a location.

Make sure to get the JRAIL pass to save money too.

Hopefully that helped anon, let me know if you have any other questions.

I'd recommend going to the Kansai region instead of Tokyo.

If you go to Tokyo, you're pretty much limited to Tokyo, which has plenty to see but it's all kind of generic and touristy by now.

>>28112537
HPV is incurable, and can sometimes lead to cancer; if you get a strain which causes warts, the individual warts can be treated, but this is painful, and they will keep popping up for several years at least.

HIV is incurable; it is usually treatable, but the drugs are very expensive and can have nasty side effects; you need to take them for life. Occasionally the drugs stop working and people die.

Herpes is incurable, and infects you for life - outbreaks become less frequent with time, but they never stop; herpes simplex 2 is excruciatingly painful; there are drugs that will help treat an outbreak, but you can't take them constantly.

Chlamydia, syphilis and gonorrhoea are usually treatable with antibiotics, but antibiotic-resistant strains of gonorrhoea and syphilis are becoming steadily more common. Note that syphilis can cause insanity or death if it isn't treated, which happens more often than you'd think, because the initial symptoms disappear after a month or two, then it comes back with a vengeance years later, having quietly damaged your central nervous system in the mean time.

Hepatitis is untreatable - you will probably eventually recover from it after several years, but you'll be very sick indeed while you're waiting; it does sometimes kill.

There are other types of bacterial infection that you can pick up from sex; these are generally treatable with antibiotics.

I discovered that lists are the best thing you can do. Go to the store and get a legal pad and a nice pen. It feels fun and interesting to go get something like this. Then sit down and make a list of all the things you need to do, doesn't have to be in order. Then start taking care of list items and just every time you do something, no matter how small, cross it off the list.

I like to put dumb things on the list to give beginners a sense of progression. Like "make coffee". Something very easy to do. It gives a sense of progression. If you do this often enough it instills a sense that you should be getting things done and it just kinda flows from there.

So I fully agree with you that the gurus in and of themselves are hocum. Best case they're unnecessary and worst case they're actively predatory. However, it seems like there's this absolutism here that simply is incorrect.

OP asked how to try and better himself. Not what gym to join, products to buy, or guru to hire. A person doesn't have to spend a dime to improve themselves (I sure as hell didn't), and no one really suggested doing so.

Speaking only of my own experiences, before I took the time to improve myself I simply wasn't capable of improving my enviroment. I felt, on many levels, that I didn't deserve anything. I put out only bad and recieved only bad in return, creating strong negativefeedback loop.

Only after breaking that cycle by improving my mental/physical health did anything change. Exercise, mostly jogging at first, and the weight loss that came with it was excellent to boost confadence, and was totally free. Only after learning to think I deserved better from others (and that they deserve the same from me) did things shift. Positive groth stacks, and unless one makes an active effort to stop it, it ripples out to their environment.
Only after fixing myself did i care enough to get active in my community. Volunteering, help others, donating to charity, enguaging with local government, etc, etc. And my consumption of goods/services has plummeted.

So why write all that off? Why be so absolutist and insist that's all null n' void?Honestly, a lot of the negative traits being leveled at self help and its supporters are in both those posts, and present a lack of self awareness that undercuts the argument.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
You have to provide a notice in writing.

Accept where another law prohibits it, you may deliver the notice in person. Otherwise you make use the normal postal or courier services available in your country to the general public. They do not have to be provided by registered service agent.

You should wait 4 days after sending it and consider the notice received and effective from that date.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28139946

I've already answered this.

Again. It means UNLESS ANOTHER LAW PROHIBITS IT you can

(A) Hand deliver the written notice.

(B) Send the written notice via the post

(C) Send the written notice via a courier service

It means you DO NOT have to

(D) Use a registered service agent to deliver the notice.

Any notice you send must be properly formatted, and be a physical piece of paper. If you elect to send the notice, any notice you send does not come into effect for four business days after it has been sent. So if you send it on a Friday, it wouldn't become effective until the following Thursday.

Again, another law may prohibit any of those actions. For example there may be a law which prohibits the general public from entering a given government department or from providing hand delivered notices to said department. It is your responsibility to check whether any other laws apply.

I would recommend to you that you hire a lawyer.

Probably not what the drafter intended, but the drafter sucks. (A lot. This is the worst notice provision I’ve ever seen.)

So the issue is that 5x5 programs and in general any program like that is for strength building, not to make the muscles pop (hypertrophy). They will get bigger to a degree but that is not really what high-weight, low-volume routines are used for.

Changing your routine will give more opportunity for your ass to get bigger, but it's going to slow down your current route (lifting heavier things). You gotta ask yourself what's your priority right now. You can always switch back, but shit takes time.

posts.name: Anonymous

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28139001
More volume. You could stay 145 and slowly add reps. You can pause longer at the bottom of each rep or do lighter weight "pulse squats" or as I said earlier you can add hip thrusts. In all those cases you're adding more time-under-tension to further exhaust the muscle. This is something you don't often do in purely strength training routines.

You'll need to eat at a light surplus and keep getting sufficient protein. Keep at it and over time you'll get bigger muscles and a bit of fat on your ass.

>>28139367

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28139367
there are some websites out there that let you ask questions about legal issues and actual lawyers will respond. I've used it in the past when I got drunk and did $10k+ in property damage although but the cops couldn't technically prove I was drunk when I did it. Lawyers gave me pretty good advise, and even more or less gave me a "good job, you totally broke the law and are more or less gonna get away with minimal financial harm and no jail time".

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28139367
Term and termination clauses generally address the term of a contract/agreement/etc., upon the expiration of which the contract/agreement/etc. terminates. So the term language describes the period constituting the term, and the termination language says the contract/agreement/etc. will terminate, and maybe also how it will do so and other related things.

Also worth noting that “term,” as we’re using it here (basically meaning time period), is different from the much more common usages of “term” in this context to mean either (1) operative words or phrases (as in “defined terms,” like “buyer” is a term defined in the contract as whoever the real person/entity) or (2) something like conditions, like “I agree to buy on these terms: no money down, 1% annual interest, and an unsecured note.”

>>28130403
You might be experiencing some form of adrenal fatigue:
https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2017/07/170731090828.htm

Since adrenal fatigue is mostly not recognized as a clinical condition you may have to self-diagnose. Here are a couple ways you can do that:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SvBi5A6iS9I

You may want to get a HOMA-IR test done to see if you have subclinical insulin resistance which could be contributing to your problem. If it is then intermittent fasting with a no refined sugar, low carb diet may provide some benefit. Thiamine supplementation, along with the other B-Complex vitamins, may help as well as these vitamins are necessary for proper adrenal health. Two teaspoons of non-fortified organic nutritional yeast mixed with almond butter may be a good habit to start your mornings as it contains most of the B vitamins your adrenals require for proper function.
A month of NAC supplementation, at 1200mg/day 600 2x/day, could be helpful if your body has been able to replete glutathione levels after so many years of marijuana use, especially int he lungs:
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10340948/
https://www.amazon.com/Pure-Encapsulations-NAC-Glycine-Powder/dp/B08WJDLHMJ

That handles the physiological part of it. Unfortunately the psychological part is far more complicated. And really there's not much I can recommend for the psychological part as much of it is dependent on your environment. With chronic stress being capable of inducing your symptoms on its own, even proper nutrition may be ineffective. That doesn't mean you shouldn't try to get the physiological side in order. Physiological health should, at the least, help to make your stress symptoms more manageable. I think it's worth trying for at least a month. When both your physiological and psychological conditions become dysregulated it's nearly impossible to achieve and maintain state which allows you to transact with society on a regular basis.

- Women can have profound interests like art, humanities and natural sciences. Inceldom imbued me the idea all young people have few profound interests beyond socializing and sex. I can have hour-long conversations with her about "autistic" topics.
- A pretty and intelligent woman like her could still feel lonely. Simply being desired matters little to them. They already know they are hot and can get laid on an axiomatic basis. They still long for a deeper bonds which remain hard to find.
- Therefore, the key to a happy partnership (not hookup) truly is le personality, common interests, the flow and biochemistry.
- Women can approach you first, based merely common interests. No, you do not have to be a 6 foot 3 ripped Gigachad model. I am definitely none.
- All your first times, dating, kissing, can still happen in your late 20s and still feel as electrifying as they probably did to 18 year olds.
I would have believed NONE of that, if I did not experience it all FIRST HAND through this particular girl. Since she exists, there must be more like her.
No, we did not have sex yet, we are merely in the early make out phase. Everything can still go wrong. But I stopped obsessing about sex anyways. I long for the feeling of being understood and desired, which I finally felt. I changed.
I still believe in the blackpill, that most of your attractiveness is pre-determined by genetics, appearance in particular. Tinder culture still disgusts me. Women filtering 80% of men based on appearance still disgusts me.
But I cannot be as desperate about women as I used to be. Worthwhile women are out there. Happiness is out there. No, you do not have to be Gigachad.
I am not leaving the incel movement yet. I still belong here. But not completely.

I’m not someone who’s dated a lot or had many relationship. I’ve had 1 gf my whole life, dated 3 girls, and had a couple more romantic encounters (with none leading to sex). I am a virgin and have never had coitus.

My last “breakup” which really wasn’t a breakup, but a sex worker I had a long emotional & physical affair with left unexpectedly. after digging around I found out she had a husband and two kids and went home to them. I was really shocked. I loved her. And didn’t know the truth about her.

I met another girl after her. Everything was going swimmingly. She was a virgin, I know this even though she didn’t say, because of the way she kissed me. I know how someone who never kissed before kisses. Using too much tounge, not enough lips . I at least know how to kiss, I’ve had enough romantic experience know that much.

We seemed good perfectly compatible. She writes in her bio how much she wants to settle down . Imagine my surprise, after knowing her for about 3 weeks and going on two dates, that all of sudden she was fired from her job and has to move. I offer her to live with me, she says no because we don’t know each other good enough and if our relationship wasn’t going to work out she can’t put herself in a situation where she relies on me. Fair enough position for a young woman to take. I say ok, and we can stay online friends. She agrees. It’s over between us.

I feel like I’ve had enough emotional validation from women in my life, even physical validation , to consider myself “worthy” in the blackpilled-incel sense. I don’t feel like I need to have sex, per say, to get that feeling.

Still, i feel so jaded . I don’t know if I can do the whole routine again. The “puppy love” stage. The emojis, the “I love yous” sharing our hopes and dreams. I want a girlfriend to love, but it seems taxing to “fall in love “ again .

How many times before it becomes mechanical? It’s only real once or twice.

>>28139954

I feel like we've run into each other before. Huh. Very kindred indeed. Anyway, for me it was the Peter Rabbit series after I was allowed to get one of the books at a yard sale. But I too grew up in the countryside in the time before internet, back when our imagination was a treasure. It took us places, and great places at that. Things were so much slower back then. Simpler too. Everything is rushed now. Less care. Something has been lost and it's hard to put a finger on what exactly it is, but we KNOW it's missing, don't we? Whether it was lost within us or within the world we live in, something is gone now and it's really sad. I'm not good with words and lack a poetic touch...it's just really sad.

I've been living in the concrete jungle now for the last decade and I just miss home. This "home" just feels like a place I'm temporarily sleeping in. No connection at all. I miss the stillness of nature. I miss the peace. I miss the comfort of a real, warm fireplace. I miss watching the rain and the ripples on the pond out back. I miss it all. And it's made worse by knowing that it's gone forever. :'(

Sorry, tangentially inclined here. I did read a quick synopsis of the Velveteen Rabbit and it was very touching. Very sad too. I relate to feeling not good enough and being discarded or set aside for burning. But it had a happy ending! And I'm sure your story will have a good ending, too. Please don't put yourself down or feel like you're going to be set ablaze. From one spirit to another, I cannot bear to see you speak about yourself like that. One day you will bloom like that flower from the Rabbit's tears, and I'm sure it will be beautiful and cherished by someone. You've already brightened what was a dark night for me, just by knowing I'm not alone. So thanks.

I'll return your good luck and send you some of my own. I have more than enough to spare. Please be well.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28139954
They might just.
It's easier for people to tear something down completely and start over than it is to fix something which has been damaged. This pattern of behavior isn't just limited to our interpersonal relationships, it's a regularly occurring phenomenon which happens throughout all facets of life.

But these days the fire, more often than not, manifests in the form of psychological warfare. This type of fire is a persistent immolation which no one can fully perceive except for the one ablaze. And when you scream out that you're being hurt, instead of receiving care, you're gaslighted back into a state of quiescence by those who can no longer tolerate your existence. Once set alight, like the old toys in the Velveteen Rabbit, you suddenly realize that this is an eat or be eaten world and you're on the menu.
And with that understanding the dreams and fantasies of your childhood become replaced with an armor without you ever realizing it. But this armor serves a purpose, it allows you to tolerate life, not really enjoy it, but to tolerate it enough to get on with it. However, you don't know you have it on and nor does almost everyone else. In time the armor becomes mistaken for being the real you. So you showcase it, polish and broadcast it out to the world. But it comes it at a cost: so long as it's mistaken for the real thing it becomes exceedingly difficult to bond thoroughly with another. Ever seen two people clad in armor try to hug? It's an awkward affair but it happens far more often than many are aware.

Of course the obvious solution would to be to just take the damn thing off. But what's underneath has troubles, it's imperfect, it's flawed; it could be seen as defective and we already know how we treat that which has been deemed defective.

Well, I don't know if any of that helped you nor am I even sure if that was my intention with this.
But this is what your post brought out of me for better or worse.

I wish you well.
